ygData.subject: Re: I know...
ygData.msgSnippet: ... What have you heard that we have not?  I have not seen a single shred of evidence indicating that the collapsible fishing pole is anything more than a wild
ygData.messageBody:
>From: "Russ Gresh" <lordgrunk@...>
>
>actually you can make the pole in the game. that doesn't mean this guy
>isn't
>lying, but if he's telling the truth perhaps there's a clue there. Start
>thinking like a child!
>
>Fixer, gnomish enchanter

What have you heard that we have not? I have not seen a single shred of
evidence indicating that the collapsible fishing pole is anything more than
a wild goose chase.

I will reiterate my earlier statement about "secrets of Everquest".. They
never remain a secret for any extended period of time. There are just too
many players, ensuring that there is a healthy population of people that
will tell the world anything new that they find. This isn't a bad thing,
but I really find it hard to believe that there are items out there in
Everquest that only a select few know about. In time, it gets posted on a
web page.
